sect3.title: NFS client with a 3Com 3c400 (ec) card
sect3.para: The 3Com 3c400 (ec) Multibus Ethernet card can only buffer two received Ethernet packets, regardless of their length, before it starts dropping packets. Unless overridden, an NFS client read requests 8 kilobytes at a time. This means six or more packets will be sent by the server, usually quickly enough to fill the card and cause the third and subsequent packets to get dropped.

NFS has an all-or-nothing mentality about it, so the client will throw away any packets it did get and just send the request again, making for a vicious cycle. The solution is to tell NFS to only request 1 kilobyte at a time, done by adding an option to the client's mount command:

sect3.title: SunOS Compatibility
sect3.para: NetBSD/sun2 will one day feature extensive binary compatibility with SunOS 3 and SunOS 4 programs, however this work has not been done yet.

sect3.title: History of NetBSD/sun2
sect3.para: The sun2 port of NetBSD was started by Matt Fredette in January 2001. He began working with NetBSD/sun3 from the 1.5 release and after a few months had it booting multiuser. In April 2001 he began merging the port into the NetBSD tree.
